metadata.title: National Solar Incentives Database
metadata.description: Comprehensive solar incentive programs for all 50 states + DC

critical_2026_context.federal_residential_itc: EXPIRED December 31, 2025 - no federal residential solar tax credit in 2026
critical_2026_context.tpo_commercial_itc: 30% commercial ITC (Section 48E) still available for TPO (lease/PPA) through 2032
critical_2026_context.domestic_content_bonus: +10% ITC for qualifying US-manufactured equipment (TPO/commercial only)
critical_2026_context.energy_community_bonus: +10% ITC for projects in designated energy communities (TPO/commercial only)
critical_2026_context.low_income_bonus: Up to +20% ITC for projects in low-income communities (TPO/commercial only)
critical_2026_context.note: All ITC bonuses apply ONLY to commercial/TPO installations, not direct residential purchases

incentives.name: Alabama Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Alabama exempts solar energy equipment from state sales tax
incentives.value: State sales tax exemption on solar equipment

incentives.name: Alabama Property Tax Abatement for Solar
incentives.description: Alabama allows property tax abatement for qualifying solar installations
incentives.value: Property tax abatement on added solar value

incentives.name: Alabama Net Metering (Limited)
incentives.description: No statewide mandatory net metering. Some utilities offer voluntary programs. TVA distributors have different rules.

incentives.name: Alaska Net Metering
incentives.description: Alaska requires utilities to offer net metering. Credits carry over indefinitely.
incentives.value: Full retail rate credit, indefinite rollover

incentives.name: Arizona Residential Solar Energy Tax Credit
incentives.description: 25% of system costs, up to $1,000 state income tax credit for residential solar installations

incentives.name: Arizona Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment is exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Arizona Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy devices are exempt from state and local transaction privilege tax

incentives.name: Arizona Net Billing / Net Metering
incentives.description: Arizona moved from net metering to net billing for most utilities. APS and TEP use export rate compensation rather than full retail credit. SRP has separate demand charge structure.
incentives.value: Export rate varies by utility (below retail)

incentives.name: Arkansas Net Metering
incentives.description: Arkansas requires investor-owned utilities to offer net metering at 1:1 retail rate for systems up to 25 kW residential.

incentives.name: California Active Solar Energy System Exclusion
incentives.description: Solar energy systems are excluded from property tax assessment. Does not increase your property tax bill.

incentives.name: California Net Billing Tariff (NEM 3.0)
incentives.description: Replaced net metering April 2023. Excess solar credited at avoided cost rates varying by time of day, day of week, and season. Significantly lower than retail rates. Strong incentive for battery storage pairing.
incentives.value: Avoided cost rate (varies, significantly below retail)

incentives.name: California Self-Generation Incentive Program (SGIP)
incentives.description: $150/kWh rebate for residential battery storage. Higher incentives for equity and equity resiliency customers in disadvantaged communities and high-fire-risk areas.

incentives.name: California PACE Financing
incentives.description: Property Assessed Clean Energy financing available statewide. Allows solar and storage financing through property tax assessment.
incentives.value: Financing option, not a direct incentive

incentives.name: Colorado Residential Renewable Energy Property Tax Exemption
incentives.description: Solar energy systems are exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Colorado Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment is exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Colorado Net Metering
incentives.description: Required for all utilities and electric cooperatives (except small municipals). 1:1 kWh credit. Annual true-up with reimbursement option or rollover.

incentives.name: Colorado Solar Performance Payments
incentives.description: Some utilities offer performance-based payments ranging from $0.005-$0.0375/kWh for solar production

incentives.name: Connecticut Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: 100% sales tax exemption for solar installations, saving the 6.35% state sales tax

incentives.name: Connecticut Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from local property tax assessment

incentives.name: Connecticut Net Metering / Netting Tariff
incentives.description: Connecticut offers net metering with full retail rate credits. All solar energy valued at full retail price.

incentives.name: Connecticut Residential Solar Investment Program
incentives.description: Rebates for residential solar PV systems up to 10 kW

incentives.name: Delaware Green Energy Program Rebate
incentives.description: Rebate of up to $700/kW, maximum $6,000 for residential solar installations

incentives.name: Delaware SREC Market
incentives.description: Delaware has an active SREC market. Current SREC-I prices around $7/MWh.

incentives.name: Delaware Net Metering
incentives.description: Delaware requires net metering for systems up to 25 kW residential

incentives.name: DC Solar Renewable Energy Credit Market
incentives.description: DC has the highest SREC values in the nation at ~$383/MWh due to aggressive RPS requirements

incentives.name: DC Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment is exempt from DC sales tax
incentives.administering_body: DC Office of Tax and Revenue

incentives.name: DC Net Metering
incentives.description: DC requires net metering for all electric utilities

incentives.name: Florida Solar Property Tax Exemption
incentives.description: 100% of solar system value is exempt from property tax assessment. Saves average of $5,500+ over system lifetime.

incentives.name: Florida Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: All solar PV equipment, including panels, inverters, batteries, EV chargers, racking, and installation costs are exempt from sales tax. Average savings ~$2,097.
incentives.value: 6% sales tax exemption on all solar equipment and installation

incentives.name: Florida Net Metering
incentives.description: Required for FPL, Duke Energy, FPU, and TECO. Full retail rate credit. Monthly rollover, annual true-up at 3-5 cents/kWh.
incentives.value: Full retail rate, annual excess at ~3-5 cents/kWh

incentives.name: Florida PACE Financing
incentives.description: PACE financing available statewide for solar and energy improvements

incentives.name: Georgia Utility Solar Rebates
incentives.description: Some Georgia utilities offer solar rebate programs. Georgia Power has had intermittent solar programs.
incentives.value: Varies by utility and program availability

incentives.name: Georgia Net Metering (Limited)
incentives.description: No statewide mandatory net metering. Georgia Power offers limited solar buy-back program.

incentives.name: Hawaii Renewable Energy Technologies Income Tax Credit
incentives.description: 35% of system cost as state income tax credit, capped at $5,000 for residential solar PV

incentives.name: Hawaii Net Energy Metering / Customer Grid Supply
incentives.description: Hawaii has transitioned from traditional net metering to Customer Grid Supply and Smart Export programs with time-of-use export rates.
incentives.value: Export credits at time-of-use rates (below retail)

incentives.name: Idaho Residential Alternative Energy Tax Deduction
incentives.description: 40% deduction in year 1 (max $5,000), then 20% in each of years 2-4 (max $5,000/year). Total max $20,000.

incentives.name: Idaho Net Metering
incentives.description: Idaho utilities voluntarily offer net metering programs. Idaho Power provides net metering for systems up to 100 kW.

incentives.name: Illinois Special Assessment for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems are valued at no more than the conventional system they replace for property tax purposes
incentives.value: Assessed at conventional system value only

incentives.name: Illinois Shines (Adjustable Block Program)
incentives.description: Performance-based incentive providing upfront payment based on projected 15-year solar production. Functions like an SREC program with block pricing that adjusts over time.
incentives.value: Upfront REC payment based on 15-year projected production

incentives.name: Illinois Net Metering
incentives.description: Illinois requires net metering from all utilities. Full retail rate credit for excess generation.

incentives.name: Illinois Community Solar Program
incentives.description: Illinois has a robust community solar market under the Climate and Equitable Jobs Act

incentives.name: Indiana Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems are exempt from personal property tax assessment
incentives.administering_body: Indiana Department of Local Government Finance

incentives.name: Indiana Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Indiana Net Metering (Transitioning)
incentives.description: Indiana transitioning from net metering to excess distributed generation rate. New interconnections may receive lower credit rate than full retail.
incentives.value: Transitioning from retail to lower rate

incentives.name: Iowa Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from property tax for 5 years

incentives.name: Iowa Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Iowa Net Metering
incentives.description: Iowa requires net metering for systems under 500 kW

incentives.name: Kansas Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Kansas Net Metering
incentives.description: Kansas requires net metering for investor-owned utilities for systems up to 200 kW

incentives.name: Kentucky Net Metering
incentives.description: Kentucky requires net metering for systems up to 45 kW. Excess compensated at avoided cost rate.
incentives.value: Net metering with avoided cost for excess

incentives.name: Louisiana Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Louisiana Net Metering
incentives.description: Louisiana requires net metering for investor-owned utilities and electric cooperatives

incentives.name: Maine Net Energy Billing
incentives.description: Maine uses net energy billing with kilowatt-hour credits. Credits can be applied to other accounts in the same utility territory.
incentives.value: Full retail rate credit with transferability

incentives.name: Maryland Residential Clean Energy Rebate Program
incentives.description: Cash-back incentive of $1,000 for residential solar systems over 1 kW

incentives.name: Maryland Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from 6% state sales tax. Saves average of $2,022.

incentives.name: Maryland Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Maryland SREC Market
incentives.description: Active SREC market with multiplier starting 2025. Up to 1.5x value for Certified SRECs. Current price ~$53.25/MWh.

incentives.name: Maryland Net Metering
incentives.description: Protected net metering for utility customers. Credits roll over indefinitely.

incentives.name: Massachusetts Residential Solar Tax Credit
incentives.description: 15% personal income tax credit on solar installation costs, up to $1,000

incentives.name: Massachusetts Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar equipment exempt from 6.25% state sales tax

incentives.name: Massachusetts Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax for 20 years

incentives.name: Massachusetts SMART Program (Solar Massachusetts Renewable Target)
incentives.description: SMART 3.0 provides fixed per-kWh incentive payments over 10 years (residential) or 20 years (commercial). Annual review of rates. Replaces older SREC program. Available through Eversource, National Grid, and Unitil. Separate SREC-II market at ~$230/MWh.

incentives.name: Massachusetts Net Metering
incentives.description: All three regulated utilities must support net metering for solar systems with inverters under 25 kW

incentives.name: Michigan Net Metering / Distributed Generation
incentives.description: Michigan requires distributed generation program for all utilities. Transitioning to new tariffs with lower export rates.
incentives.value: Varies by utility, transitioning from retail

incentives.name: Michigan Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Minnesota Solar Energy Property Tax Exemption
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Minnesota Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Minnesota Net Metering
incentives.description: Minnesota requires net metering for all utilities

incentives.name: Minnesota Community Solar Garden Program
incentives.description: Robust community solar program, one of the largest in the nation. Xcel Energy community solar garden program.
incentives.value: Bill credits for community solar subscribers

incentives.name: Mississippi Net Metering
incentives.description: Mississippi requires net metering for investor-owned and cooperative utilities

incentives.name: Missouri Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Missouri Net Metering
incentives.description: Missouri requires net metering for investor-owned utilities for systems up to 100 kW

incentives.name: Montana Net Metering
incentives.description: Montana requires net metering for systems up to 50 kW

incentives.name: Montana Sales Tax - No State Sales Tax
incentives.description: Montana has no state sales tax, so solar equipment is naturally exempt

incentives.name: Nebraska Net Metering
incentives.description: Nebraska public power districts offer net metering. Voluntary programs vary by utility.

incentives.name: Nevada Net Metering
incentives.description: Nevada offers net metering with export credit rates that vary by utility and rate schedule. NV Energy provides time-of-use export credits.
incentives.value: Export credits at ~75% of retail rate

incentives.name: New Hampshire Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax. Municipalities may opt in or out.
incentives.value: 100% of added solar value exempt (where adopted)

incentives.name: New Hampshire - No State Sales Tax
incentives.description: New Hampshire has no state sales tax

incentives.name: New Hampshire Net Metering
incentives.description: New Hampshire requires net metering for systems up to 1 MW

incentives.name: New Jersey SREC-II (Successor Solar Incentive)
incentives.description: $85/MWh for 15 years for net-metered rooftop and carport systems. Ground-mount rates vary. NJBPU plans to review pricing March 2026.
incentives.administering_body: New Jersey Board of Public Utilities

incentives.name: New Jersey Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: New Jersey Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from local property tax assessment

incentives.name: New Jersey Net Metering
incentives.description: NJBPU requires all investor-owned utilities to provide net metering at full retail rate. No system size cap.
incentives.value: Full retail rate credit, no size cap

incentives.name: New Mexico Solar Market Development Tax Credit
incentives.description: 10% of system installation costs or $6,000, whichever is lower. State income tax credit.
incentives.administering_body: New Mexico Energy, Minerals and Natural Resources Department

incentives.name: New Mexico Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from gross receipts tax

incentives.name: New Mexico Net Metering
incentives.description: New Mexico requires net metering for systems up to 80 MW

incentives.name: New York State Solar Energy System Equipment Tax Credit
incentives.description: 25% of system costs as state income tax credit, up to $5,000
incentives.administering_body: New York State Department of Taxation and Finance

incentives.name: NYSERDA NY-Sun Megawatt Block Incentive
incentives.description: Upfront $/W rebate through NYSERDA's Megawatt Block structure. Incentive levels decrease as blocks fill up. May expire for market-rate homes before end of 2025; continues for LMI households.

incentives.name: New York Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: 15-year property tax exemption for solar energy systems

incentives.name: New York Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from state and local sales tax
incentives.administering_body: New York Department of Taxation and Finance

incentives.name: New York Net Metering
incentives.description: New York requires net metering for all major utilities

incentives.name: New York Community Distributed Generation
incentives.description: Robust community solar market. Subscribers receive bill credits for their share of community solar project production.

incentives.name: North Carolina Duke Energy Solar + Storage Rebate
incentives.description: Duke Energy Progress: $250/kW solar rebate. Duke Energy Carolinas solar+battery rebates up to $9,000. TVA: $1,000 post-installation.

incentives.name: North Carolina Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: 80% of the appraised value of the solar energy system is exempt from property tax

incentives.name: North Carolina Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: North Carolina Net Metering
incentives.description: North Carolina requires net metering for investor-owned utilities for systems up to 1 MW

incentives.name: North Dakota Net Metering
incentives.description: North Dakota requires net metering at avoided cost rate (not full retail)

incentives.name: North Dakota Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Ohio SREC Market
incentives.description: Active SREC market with current prices around $3.30/MWh. Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, and West Virginia can participate through Ohio market.

incentives.name: Ohio Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Ohio Net Metering
incentives.description: Ohio requires net metering for all electric distribution utilities. No system size cap.

incentives.name: Oklahoma Net Metering
incentives.description: Oklahoma requires investor-owned utilities to offer net metering for systems up to 100 kW

incentives.name: Oregon Utility Solar Rebates
incentives.description: Portland General Electric: $1,200 rebate. Pacific Power: $900 rebate for residential solar.

incentives.name: Oregon Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy system value excluded from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Oregon - No State Sales Tax
incentives.description: Oregon has no state sales tax

incentives.name: Oregon Net Metering
incentives.description: Oregon requires net metering at full retail rate for systems up to 25 kW residential

incentives.name: Pennsylvania SREC Market
incentives.description: Active SREC market with current prices around $22.95/MWh

incentives.name: Pennsylvania Net Metering
incentives.description: Pennsylvania requires net metering for all electric distribution companies

incentives.name: Rhode Island Renewable Energy Fund Grant
incentives.description: Grants up to $5,000 for residential solar installations

incentives.name: Rhode Island Renewable Energy Growth Program
incentives.description: Performance-based incentive paying $0.2875/kWh for 15 years for small solar installations

incentives.name: Rhode Island Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Rhode Island Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Rhode Island Net Metering
incentives.description: Rhode Island requires net metering for all electric distribution companies

incentives.name: South Carolina Solar Energy Tax Credit
incentives.description: 25% of system costs as state income tax credit. Maximum 50% of annual tax liability with 10-year carryover.
incentives.value: 25% of costs, max 50% of annual liability, 10-year carryover

incentives.name: South Carolina Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: South Carolina Net Metering
incentives.description: Utilities credit consumers for every kWh of solar energy returned to the grid. Credits applied to following months' bills.
incentives.value: Full retail rate credit with monthly rollover

incentives.name: South Dakota Sales Tax Exemption for Renewable Energy
incentives.description: South Dakota exempts renewable energy systems from sales tax

incentives.name: Tennessee Sales Tax Exemption for Solar (Limited)
incentives.description: Tennessee provides limited sales tax exemptions for solar energy equipment

incentives.name: Tennessee Valley Authority Programs
incentives.description: TVA distributors may offer solar programs. TVA $1,000 post-installation payment available in some areas.

incentives.name: Texas Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar system value is not considered when determining assessed property value. Prevents property tax increase from solar installation. Average 4%+ home value increase is tax-free.

incentives.name: Texas Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Texas Utility Solar Rebates
incentives.description: AEP Texas: up to $2,500 per residential solar system. Oncor: solar+storage rebate. Other utilities vary.

incentives.name: Texas Net Metering (No Statewide Mandate)
incentives.description: No statewide net metering requirement. Some utilities (TXU Energy, others) voluntarily offer net metering or buy-back programs.
incentives.value: Varies by utility - no statewide mandate

incentives.name: Utah Net Metering / Export Credit
incentives.description: Utah offers net metering with transitioning rates. Rocky Mountain Power provides export credits.

incentives.name: Vermont Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Vermont Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Vermont Net Metering
incentives.description: Vermont requires net metering for all utilities

incentives.name: Virginia Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from local property tax. Localities may opt in.
incentives.value: 100% of added solar value exempt (where adopted)

incentives.name: Virginia Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Virginia Net Metering
incentives.description: Virginia requires net metering for systems up to 20 kW residential

incentives.name: Washington Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar PV equipment and installation labor exempt from state sales tax
incentives.value: Sales tax exemption on equipment and labor

incentives.name: Washington Renewable Energy System Incentive Program
incentives.description: Production incentive averaging $720/year. Rate: $0.08-$0.12/kWh depending on system and equipment origin.

incentives.name: Washington Net Metering
incentives.description: Washington UTC requires net metering for all investor-owned utilities and many public utilities

incentives.name: West Virginia Net Metering (Limited)
incentives.description: West Virginia has minimal solar incentives. Some net metering provisions exist but are limited.

incentives.name: Wisconsin Property Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy systems exempt from property tax assessment

incentives.name: Wisconsin Sales Tax Exemption for Solar
incentives.description: Solar energy equipment exempt from state sales tax

incentives.name: Wisconsin Net Metering
incentives.description: Wisconsin requires net metering for systems up to 20 kW
incentives.value: Full retail rate credit for systems up to 20 kW

incentives.name: Wyoming Net Metering
incentives.description: Wyoming requires net metering for investor-owned utilities for systems up to 25 kW
incentives.value: Net metering available for small systems
